citations.narrative:
The licensee has not been maintaining complete and up to date medical records for the adult dogs in the kennel. The
medical records lack required information such as dates and types of vaccines administered, medications given, illnesses
or injuries identified, and treatments or testing completed. Lack of complete and timely medical records cannot ensure
that appropriate veterinary care is being provided to the dogs. Complete and up to date medical records must be
maintained for the dogs in the kennel.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class A license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by June 29, 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.13(b) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee has not been maintaining complete and up to date medical records for the adult dogs in the kennel. The 
medical records lack required information such as dates and types of vaccines administered, medications given, illnesses 
or injuries identified, and treatments or testing completed. Lack of complete and timely medical records cannot ensure 
that appropriate veterinary care is being provided to the dogs. Complete and up to date medical records must be 
maintained for the dogs in the kennel. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class A license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by June 29, 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
